title: Trump Redesignates Iran-Backed Houthis As Foreign Terrorist Organization
description: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to once again designate Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels a "foreign terrorist organization," the White House announced Wednesday.
excerpt: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to once again designate Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels a "foreign terrorist organization," the White House announced Wednesday.
text: Former president Joe Biden had lifted that label when he took over the White House from Trump in 2021 Washington: US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to once again designate Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels a "foreign terrorist organization," the White House announced Wednesday.Former president Joe Biden had lifted that label when he took over the White House from Trump in 2021, before later calling them a "specially designated global terrorist" entity, a slightly less severe classification which still allowed for humanitarian aid to reach the war-torn country.(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
html:
Former president Joe Biden had lifted that label when he took over the White House from Trump in 2021

Washington:

US President Donald Trump signed an executive order to once again designate Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels a "foreign terrorist organization," the White House announced Wednesday.

Former president Joe Biden had lifted that label when he took over the White House from Trump in 2021, before later calling them a "specially designated global terrorist" entity, a slightly less severe classification which still allowed for humanitarian aid to reach the war-torn country.

(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
